title: mr pickles
author: mr pickles
content: Hi everyone, new to mining. I am preparing to start my little adventure, know about btc but not much about electronics and calculationsI have 1.5/2k Â usd to invest in a btc asic miner, new or used. I was thinking about a used antminer s19 or 2 new L3+, suggest me please considering energy efficiencythen i have a limited amount of free electricity (up to a certain level) given to me by a family person, i estimate 100 kwh per monthI am in just to accumulate satoshis, so not to sell it in order to repay the hardware or billsdo all this make sense? thanks

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: L3+ is not a Bitcoin miner its an altcoin miner if you are looking for efficiency use some tools to find the right unit for efficiency.Try this one https://www.asicminervalue.com/efficiency/sha-256And I think you can optimize any units for efficiency but you will need to switch them to modded firmware like asic.to and braiins OS.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: The Antminer S19 is a good option for your budget and is relatively energy efficient for its mining capabilities. However, purchasing a used miner carries a higher risk as it may have been damaged or may not perform as well, or as long, as a new one, so it is also important to consider that when making your decision. It may be a better idea to invest in a new miner to ensure optimal performance and longevity.
